sspb.pages.sspb_page.name: SSPB
sspb.options.shadowyness.name: Shadowyness
sspb.options.shadowyness.tooltip:
Adjusts the strength of the vanilla-like shadows on non-full blocks

0% - None (Sodium default)
85% - SSPB Default
100% - Max (Vanilla strength, but may be darker than vanilla in certain cases)

Does not affect path blocks when "Use vanilla lighting for path blocks" is enabled.
sspb.options.onlyaffectpathblocks.name: Only affect path blocks
sspb.options.onlyaffectpathblocks.toolti:
The bug in vanilla Minecraft that causes shadowy path blocks actually affects all non-fluid non-full blocks

By default, SSPB applies the vanilla-like smooth lighting to all non-fluid non-full blocks as well. Enabling this will limit the effects to path blocks only.
sspb.options.vanillapathblocklighting.na: Use vanilla lighting for path blocks
sspb.options.vanillapathblocklighting.to:
When enabled, the lighting for path blocks will be rendered with a vanilla-accurate algorithm, rather than a modified version of Sodium's lighting algorithm.

This option disables the effect of the shadowyness slider on path blocks.

This option requires Indium and Fabric API to be installed.
